original: Block, Ada Kristina Petronella, apotekare, Hemse, f. 7/11/95 i Fröjel, Goitl. 1., av sjökapt. Petter Reinhold Ferdinand Pettersson o. Emma Christina Muldin. G. 23-40 m. civ :ing. Viktor Block. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 15, farm. kand. 18, apot :ex. 30. Elev v. apot. i Eksjö 15-17, farm. kand. å Ostgöta Lejon i Norrköp. 18-19, i Visby 19-23, i Alingsås, Borrby o. Hemse 24-28, leg. apot. i Visby 29-40, personl. priv. å apot. i Hemse m. filialapot. i Klintehamn sed. 40. Ledare av me-dicinalväxtinsaml. på Gotl. sed. 41. Rev. i styr. f. Sv:es kristl. farmaceut-förb. sed. 26, riksantikv. omb. i Hemse sed. 43, Gotl. fornvänners omb. i Hem- se sed. 44, suppl. i styr. f. Gotl. forn-vänner sed. 46, medl. av Sv. fornmin-nesfören. o. Ortnamnssällsk. i Upps, Hobbies: arkivforskn. samt samhng av Gotlandslitteratur o. gotl. antikviteter.
translated: Block, Ada Kristina Petronella, pharmacist, Hemse, b. November 7, 1895 in Fröjel, Gotland, daughter of sea captain Petter Reinhold Ferdinand Pettersson and Emma Christina Muldin. Married in 1923 to civil engineer Viktor Block. Education: graduated from high school in Uppsala in 1915, earned a degree in pharmacy in 1918, and became a licensed pharmacist in 1930. Worked as an assistant at a pharmacy in Eksjö from 1915-1917, at Ostgöta Lejon in Norrköping from 1918-1919, in Visby from 1919-1923, and in Alingsås, Borrby, and Hemse from 1924-1928. Became a licensed pharmacist in Visby from 1929-1940, and a personal private pharmacist in Hemse with a branch pharmacy in Klintehamn since 1940. Leader of medicinal plant collecting on Gotland since 1941. Was a member of the board of the Swedish Christian Pharmacist Association from 1926 and was a representative for the national antiquity authority in Hemse since 1943. Also represented Gotland's Antiquarian Society in Hemse since 1944, served as supplementary member of the board for the Gotland Antiquarian Society since 1946, and was a member of the Swedish Antiquities Society and Place Name Society in Uppsala. Hobbies include archival research and the collection of Gotland literature and antiquities.

structured.name: Ada Kristina Petronella Block
structured.description: Leader of medicinal plant collecting on Gotland
structured.hobbies: Archival research and collection of Gotland literature and antiquities
